title: Intune(updating)
content:
Intune部署项目

基于校园环境，可同时参考权限适用于办公环境

  • 50台ipad & 30台Windows Laptop
  • 限制安装非指定应用（如有需要IT权限安装）
  • 限制访问非指定网站（通过白名单管理）

Enviorment Introduction

Apple System Version Requirements(Need to prepare the Apple ID for each device)

- Apple iOS 15.0 and later
- Apple iPadOS 15.0 and later
- macOS 12.0 and later

Windows System Version Requirements

- Windows 11
The supported versions include Windows 11 Pro、Enterprise and Education。
- Windows 10
The supported versions include Windows 10 Pro、Enterprise and Education。

IOS certificate registration and upload

Before controlling an Apple device, need to download a certificate file 
to register an Apple device in order to push profiles to the Apple device

Login to IntunePortal｜ Select Devices｜Select iOS/iPadOS | Select Enrollment

Select Apple MDM Push Certificate

- Select agree
- download CSR file
- going to this site : https://identity.apple.com/pushcert/
- upload the CSR file and download PEM Certificate for Apple
- back to Intune Portal and Enter the same Apple ID as in the identity portal 
and upload the downloaded PEM certificate

Tips：
- Apple ID must use the type used for business
- The PEM certificate needs to be updated annually

Sign up for Apple Business Manager

Sign up your organisation
1.Go to https://business.apple.com/.

2.Select “Sign up now”.

3.Enter and review the following organisation information:

-The first and last name of the individual enrolling on behalf of the organisation

-Important: This must be a legal, human name. First and last names such as “IT Coordinator” or “Apple Deployment” will be returned to you to correct the information.

-a work email address that is not associated with an App Store or iCloud account, and has not been used as an Apple ID for any other Apple service or website

Note: This email address becomes your administrator Managed Apple ID. See Initial administrator account email address requirements.

-The name of your organisation

Note: This name may change when you verify your organisation.

-The website URL

Note: This is an optional field, but providing it can expedite your organisation’s verification process.

4.Select whether to get news and updates about Apple Business Essentials, then select Continue.

5.Create and confirm a new password for your new account, then select a region code and enter your phone number.

A one-time verification code is sent to your email address first, then a different code is sent to your phone number.

6.Follow the remaining steps, then select Get Started to start using Apple Business Manager and Apple Business Essentials.

Verify your enrolment
After you verify enrolment, you can take full advantage of all the features of Apple Business Manager and Apple Business Essentials.

1.Go to https://business.apple.com/.

2.Sign in with your administrator account, then go to your organization settings.

3.Select Verify, then enter your organisation’s Data Universal Numbering System D-U-N-S Number.

To learn more about locating or requesting a D-U-N-S Number, see D-U-N-S® Number on the Apple Developer website.

4.Enter verification contact information (name, email and Role/Job title) that Apple can call to verify your organisation.

Examples include your managing director, IT director or finance director.

5.Check your email for a message from Apple Business Manager with the subject line “Your enrolment is in review”.

During the review process, your verification contact is contacted and asked to confirm information about you and your organisation before your enrolment is approved. Make sure that any filters allow mail from all apple.com domains. Return any missed phone calls quickly so the enrolment process can proceed smoothly.

6.After your organisation is approved, immediately create at least one additional 
user that has the role of Administrator. See Add administrators.

- Important: If you forget or lose your password before the creation of 
at least one additional administrator, use the iforgot.apple.com website to reset your password.

Intune connects to ABM

Intune needs to establish a connection with ABM through a certificate before it can associate Apple devices on ABM with Intune

Login to IntunePortal｜ Select Devices｜Select Enroll devices | Select Enrollment program tokens

-Select Add
-Select agree
-Download public key(CSR file)
-Upload public key(CSR file) to ABM portal create new MDM server
-Download MDM Server token, back to Intune portal 
enter ABM manage Apple ID and upload apple token

Tips：The uploaded Apple certificate needs to be updated annually

Create an Apple automatic registration configuration file

After connecting to ABM, it is necessary to continue creating an Apple device 
auto registration file

Login to IntunePortal｜ Select Devices｜Select Enroll devices 
| Select Enrollment program tokens ｜ Select Created tokens

1.Select profiles
2.Select Create profile
3.User affinity  Enroll： with User Affinity
4.Authentication Method：Setup Assistant with modern authentication
5.Hide function settings according to requirements
6.Set default profile

Add iPad through Apple Configurator-Create WiFi configuration file & Prepare

Creating a Wi-Fi profile (optional operation)
- File
- Create a new description file
- Select WIFI
- Save the file after configuration is complete

Connect the device to Apple Configurator
- Select prepare

Add iPad through Apple Configurator-Prepare Devices

The below settings must be selected:
◦ Manual Configuration.
◦ Add to Apple School Manager or Apple Business
Manager.
◦ Allow devices to pair with other computers.
Do not select:
◦ Activate and complete enrollment.
◦ Enable Shared iPad.

Add iPad through Apple Configurator-Prepare Devices

-This is the first time the operation is run on this Mac, create a “New Server”.
-Create New Server

Home >Devices |iOS/iPadOs >iOS/iPadOs |Enrollment > Apple Configurator |Profiles > Export profile
-The Profile URL from the Setup Assistant Enrollment.

Add iPad through Apple Configurator-Define an MDM Server

Add trust anchor certificate for MDM
server.Select the one with the Microsoft or Azure
name on the list
◦ appleconfigurator2.manage.microsoft.com
◦ portal.azure.com
◦ endpoint.microsoft.com

- Default operation next step

Add iPad through Apple Configurator-Sign in ABM account

- Authenticate to ABM/ASM with an account with
the “Device Enrollment Manager” role assigned
- Upload the WiFi description file created before uploading
- Click Next to start device registration
- The registration process is automated and may result in some errors, 
but the device should have already been added to the ABM backend

Ipad/IOS Basic restrictions

IPad basic function limitations
Login to: https://intune.microsoft.com/
1.Select Devices
2.Select Manage Devices | Configuration
3.Create New Policy
 
Platform:  iOS/iPadOS
Profile Type: Device restrictions

4. Set policy name

5.Select App Store, Doc Viewing, Gaming

Select Block App store

IPad restricts websites

IPad restricts websites through Policy browser
Login to: https://intune.microsoft.com/
1.Select Devices
2.Select Manage Devices | Configuration
3.Create New Policy
 
Platform:  iOS/iPadOS
Profile Type: Device features

4. Set policy name

5.Select Web Content Filter
Filter Type: Specific websites only
Specific websites only
URL		Bookmark Path		Title
baidu.com         Not configured                baidu

IOS/iPad OS registration with Company portal

IOS/IpadOS device registration

1.Download Company Portal from AppStore
2.Download the configuration file after logging into Company Portal using EntraID
3.Enter Settings - General VPN Device Management - Install Configuration Files
4.Automatically bind to Intune in Company Portal

IOS/iPad OS registration with ABM

IOS/Ipad OS device registration

1.Add devices to ABM through Apple Configurator
2.Assign devices to corresponding MDM servers
3.After connecting the mobile phone to WiFi, operate the registration device
4.Automatically download configuration files after entering the EntraID account 
for registering the device
5.After successful registration, you can see control prompts on the settings page

Control Windows local account access

Restricting Windows EntraID users to User privileges
Login to:  https://portal.azure.com/
EntraID account PC permission control default setting: Normal User (restricting software installation permissions)
Sign in to the Microsoft Entra admin center as a Global Administrator.
Select Device
Select Device Setting
Set EntraID local administrator account (authorized by the administrator to temporarily install applications)
Select Manage Additional local administrators on all Microsoft Entra joined devices

Control Windows browsing website(Edge or Chrome)

Windows restricts websites through Policy browser
Login to: https://intune.microsoft.com/

1.Select Devices | Windows
2.Select Configuration
3.Create New Policy
 
Platform  Windows 10 and later 
Profile Type Settings catalog

4. Set policy name

5.Select Microsoft Edge
Block access to a list of URLs Enable
Block access to a list of URLs (Device)
Value：*
Define a list of allowed URLs Enabled
Define a list of allowed URLs (Device)
Value：baidu.com, edge://policy

Windows registration

1.Windows device registration
To reset or create a new device, you can directly enter EntraID to log in and register

2.Non remanufactured equipment or new equipment
After entering the system, it will automatically register and pull the configuration file
